Name: Is there a distinct category of dual for verbal agreement with a dual subject?
Is non-agreement in number between the nominal subject and verbal predicate possible?
Example: Челядь сьылöны;[t͡ɕeʎɑɟ ɕɨl-ɘnɨ];children sing-PRS.3PL;Children are singing;

Name: Can finite verbs agree in number with the nominal object?
Can an adnominal property word agree with the noun in case?
Are there cases that do not show agreement in terms of case?
Example: бур ёрт-тöг;good[NOM] friend-ABE;without a good friend;|бур ёрт-кöд;good[NOM] friend-COM;with a good friend;
Comment: The adnominal property word and the head noun do not show agreement.

Name: Can adpositions be used to mark core verbal arguments?
Can adpositions be used to mark non-core/oblique verbal arguments?
Example: куим лун мысти;[kuim lun mɨsci];three day after;after three days;

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (S/A) marking?
Example: Oľgɑ ɑďďź-is Annɑ-lyś kotört-öm-sö dɑ pyr žö mun-is bör-śɑń-ys;Olga see-PST.3SG Anna-ABL run-DER-ACC.3SG and at.once  also go-PST.3SG after-EGR-3SG;Olga saw that/how Anna ran off and went after her immediately;elicited

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (P) marking?
Do characteristics of object referent (topicality, animacy, definiteness) influence object marking?
Example: Ме аддзa кaньöс;[me ɑd͡d͡ʑ-ɑ kɑɲ-ɘs];1SG see-PRS.1SG cat-ACC;I see a cat;|Ме аддза керка;[me ɑd͡d͡ʑ-ɑ kerkɑ];1SG see-PRS.1SG house[ACC];I see a house;
Comment: Object marking depends on the animateness and definiteness.

Name: Does object marking correlate with aspectuality?
Does the marking of the object depend on the verb conjugation form?
Is there differential subject marking?
Example: пызан вылын нянь;[pɨzɑn vɨlɨn ɲɑɲ];table on bread;There is some bread on the table;|няньыс пызан вылын;[ɲɑɲ-ɨs pɨzɑn vɨlɨn];bread-POSS.3SG table on;The bread is on the table;

Name: Can S and A be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Example: Зон окыштiс нылöc и пышйис;[Zon okɨʃt-is nɨl-ɘs i pɨʃj-is];boy kiss-PST.3SG girl-ACC and run-PST.3SG;The boy kissed the girl and ran away;

Name: Can S and P be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Is there a grammatical device for habituality?
Example: Сиктын олiгöн ме ветлывлi вöрö;[ɕikt-ɨn ol-igɘn me vetlɨ-vl-i vɘr-ɘ];country-INE live-CVB 1SG go.and.come.back-FRQ-PST.1SG forest-ILL;When I lived in the country I used to go to the forest;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for frequentative?
Example: Аддзысь-лывлы-;[ɑd͡d͡ʑɨɕ-lɨvlɨ-];meet-FRQ;to meet repeatedly, regularly;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for progressivity?
Is it common to use a verb in the present tense for future time reference?
Example: Аски муна карö;[aski mun-a kar-ɘ];tomorrow go-PRS.1SG city-ILL;Tomorrow I will go to the city;
Comment: However, in the case of 3rd person, the verb appears in the future tense.

Name: Is there a grammatical device for immediate future?
Is there a grammatical device for pluperfect?
Example: Миян вотöдз сiйö мунöма вöлi;[mijɑn vo-tɘd͡ʑ sijɘ mun-ɘmɑ vɘl-i];1PL.GEN arrive-CVB 3SG go-2PST.3SG be-PST.3SG;(It turned out that) s/he had left before we arrived;

Name: Can aspect be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Can tense be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Example: Ме ог тöд;[me o-g tɘd];1SG NEG.PRS-1SG know.CNG.SG;I do not know;|Ме эг тöд;[me e-g tɘd];1SG NEG.PST-1SG know.CNG.SG;I did not know;

Name: Is there grammatical marking of mirativity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of desire or wish?
Is there morphological marking for irrealis (e.g. hypothetical state of affairs)?
Are verbs marked in a specific mood in counterfactual conditional clauses?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic necessity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of epistemic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 3Sg?
Comment: Usually the particle мед [med] + future form is used.

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 1Sg?
Is it common to use the imperative/jussive in complement clauses introduced by predicates expressing wish/desire/will?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of apprehension?
Is there reflexive conjugation?
Are there syntactically ditransitive verbs?
Can non-singular 2nd and 3rd person have the same person/number marking or morphosyntactic treatment?
Can an impersonal (or passive) form be used instead of a finite plural form with an overt subject expression?
Can third person plural verb forms be used for impersonal reference?
Example: Шыд сёйöны паньöн;[ʃɨd ɕoj-ɘnɨ pɑɲ-ɘn];soup[ACC] eat-PRS.3PL spoon-INS;Soup is eaten with a spoon;

Name: Can second person singular verb forms be used in generic meaning?
Example: Кольöматö он бергöд;[koʎ-ɘmɑ-tɘ o-n bergɘd];pass-PTCP.PST-ACC.POSS.2SG NEG.PRS-2SG return.CNG.SG;It is not possible to return the past;

Name: Are clauses with only infinitive predicates possible?
Example: Мый öнi вöчны?;[mɨj ɘni vɘt͡ɕ-nɨ];what now to do-INF;What to do now?;

Name: Can verbs in purposive subordinate clauses be in bare infinitive form?
Example: Муна Венгрияö, медым велöдны венгр кыв;[mun-ɑ vengrijɑ-ɘ, medɨm velɘd-nɨ vengr kɨv];go-PRS.1SG Hungary-ILL in.order.to study-INF hungarian language[ACC];I’m going to Hungary in order to study Hungarian;

Name: Are there sentences without overt verbal arguments (e.g. weather verbs)?
Example: зэрö [zer-ɘ];rain-PRS.3SG;It is raining;

Name: Is copula needed for predicate nominals in the 3rd person form of the present tense?
Is a copula needed for predicate nominals in the past and/or future tense?
Example: Ме вöлi/лоа велöдысьöн;[me vɘl-i/lo-ɑ velɘdɨɕ-ɘn];1SG be-PST.1SG/be-FUT.1SG teacher-INS;I was/will be a teacher;

Name: Can locative adverbial phrases act as predicates without a copula?
Example: Ме гортын;[me gort-ɨn];1SG home-INE;I am at home;

Name: Can the same coordinating conjunction be used for NPs, VPs, and clauses?
Does existential negation have a separate operator?
Example: Ме абу йöй [me ɑbu jɘj];1SG NEG stupid;I am not stupid;

Name: Can standard negation be asymmetric in the present tense?
Example: ме тöда : ме ог тöд;[me tɘd-ɑ : me o-g tɘd];1SG know-1SG : 1SG NEG.PRS-1SG know.CNG.SG;I know : I don’t know;

Name: Can non-finite dependent clauses use the standard negation construction?
Is there a special negator that combines with non-finite forms?
Example: новлы-тöм паськöм;[novlɨ-tɘm pɑɕkɘm];wear-PTCP.NEG clothes;clothes which have not been worn;|шойччытöг уджалам;[ʃojt͡t͡ɕɨ-tɘg ud͡ʒɑl-ɑm];rest-CVB.NEG work-PRS.2PL;We work without having a rest;
Comment: The negative participle -тöм [-tɘm] and the negative converb тöг [-tɘg] are used.

Name: Are there special negative non-finite forms?
Example: шойччытöг уджалам;[ʃojt͡t͡ɕɨ-tɘg ud͡ʒɑl-ɑm];rest-CVB.NEG work-PRS.2PL;We work without having a rest;

Name: Is there an impersonal passive construction?
Are there nonfinite forms specialized on the relativization of particular core participants, e.g. subjects (S/A), direct objects (P), absolutive participants (S/P)?
Example: гижысь зон;[giʒ-ɨɕ zon];write-PTCP boy;a writing boy;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least all core participants (S/A/P) and possibly also some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials, instruments, etc.?
Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials or instruments, but cannot relativize all or some of the core participants, e.g. subjects?
Example: Менам олан керкаöй;[menam ol-ɑn kerkɑ-ɘj];1SG.GEN live-PTCP house-POSS.1SG;My living house;

Name: Is there a specialized negative participial form, which cannot be analyzed as a specific participial marker + negation marker?
Example: новлытöм паськöм;[novlɨ-tɘm pɑɕkɘm];wear-PTCP.NEG clothes;clothes which have not been worn;

Name: Is there a future participle?
Are there participles that can encode their subject by possessive suffixes?
Can subject in at least some participial subordinate clauses be encoded in the same way as in independent clauses?
Are there participles that obligatorily agree with the nouns they modify in case and number (in all contexts)?
Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and action nominalizations?
Example: велöдчöм морт;[velɘdt͡ɕ-ɘm mort];learn-PTCP person;educated person;|кузя велöдчöм;[kuʑ-ɑ velɘdt͡ɕ-ɘm];long-DER learn-NMLZ;long-running education;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and agentive nominalizations?
Example: гижысь зон;[giʒ-ɨɕ zon];write-PTCP boy;a writing boy;гижысь;[giʒ-ɨɕ];write-NMLZ;a writer;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and converbs without any additional morphological material, such as case markers?
Example: мöвпалана чужöм;[mɘvpɑl-ɑnɑ t͡ɕuʒɘm];cogitate-PTCP face;thoughtful face;|мöвпалана видзöд-ны;[mɘvpɑl-ɑnɑ vid͡ʑɘd-nɨ];cogitate-CVB to.look-INF;to look thoughtfully;
Comment: The converb in -ана [-ana] is relatively new in Komi, and it is more used in literature.

Name: Is OV the neutral order in affirmative imperative clauses?
Example: чай ю!;[t͡ɕɑj ju];tea[ACC] drink.IMP.2SG;Drink tea!;

Name: Is it possible to place an object between the negative marker and the main verb in imperative constructions?
Example: Эн менö велöд!;[en menɘ velɘd];NEG.IMP 1SG.ACC teach.IMP.2SG;Do not teach me!;

Name: Are there preverbs?
Are there verbal prefixes?
Is there diminutive (hypocoristic) marking on verbs?
Example: Ме эськö сёйышті;[me eɕkɘ ɕoj-ɨʃt-i];1SG COND eat-DIM-PST.1SG;I would eat a little;

Name: Can modifiers of action nominalization in agent and patient roles both be marked like possessors?
Can the modifier of action nominalization in patient role (e.g. "drinking of coffee") be marked like the direct object?
Example: челядьöс велöдöм;[t͡ɕeʎɑɟ-ɘs velɘd-ɘm];children-ACC teach-NMLZ;teaching of children;|ме велöда челядьöс;[me velɘd-ɑ t͡ɕeʎɑɟ-ɘs];1SG teach-PRS.1SG children-ACC;I teach children;

Name: Do core adjectives agree with the subject noun in number in the predicative position?
Example: зонъяс кузьöсь;[zon-jɑs kuʑ-ɘɕ];boy-PL long-PL;The boys are tall;

Name: Is it possible to form synthetic superlative?
Example: мича : мичаджык : медмича;[mit͡ɕɑ : mit͡ɕɑ-d͡ʒɨk : med-mit͡ɕɑ];beautiful : beautiful-COMP : SPRL-beautiful;beautiful : more beautiful : the most beautiful;

Name: Can adpositions have person/number marking?
Example: водзам;[vod͡ʑ-ɑm];in.front-POSS.1SG;in front of me;|водзад;[vod͡ʑ-ɑd];in.front-POSS.2SG;in front of you;

Name: Are there separate adpositions to express goal, source, and location (without there being syncretism)?
Example: Муна керка сайö;[mun-ɑ kerkɑ sɑj-ɘ];go-PRS.1SG house behind-ILL;I go behind the house;|Ме керка сайын;[me kerkɑ sɑj-ɨn];1SG house behind-INE;I am behind the house;|Пета керка сайысь;[pet-ɑ kerkɑ sɑj-ɨɕ];exit-PRS.1SG house behind-ELA;I exit from behind the house;

Name: Is case compounding possible?
Example: Менам керкаöй Сандралöнсянь ылынджык;[menɑm kerkɑ-ɘj sɑndrɑ-lɘn-ɕɑɲ ɨlɨn-d͡ʒɨk];I.GEN house-POSS.1SG Sandra-GEN-EGR far-COMP;My house is farther than Sandra's [house];

Name: Are there case categories only found in pronouns?
Does the numeral modification of a noun have an effect on its case selection?
Is the singular form of the noun also used with numerals bigger than 1?
Example: öти небöг : куим небöг;[ɘci ɲebɘg : kuim ɲebɘg];one book[NOM.SG] : three book[NOM.SG];one book : three books;

Name: Is there a genitive case that has an affix?
Example: менам ёртлöн вокыс;[menɑm jort-lɘn vok-ɨs];1SG.GEN friend-GEN brother-POSS.3SG;my friend's brother;

Name: Is there a dative case used to express indirect object/receiver/goal (different from a local case)?
Example: Cет меным кыв!;[ɕet menɨm kɨv];give.IMP.2SG 1SG.DAT word[ACC];Give me the word!;

Name: Is there a terminative case?
Example: аскиöдз;[ɑski-ɘd͡ʑ];tomorrow-TERM;until tomorrow;

Name: Is there a separate case to indicate without what/who an action takes place / does not take place?
Example: Cьöмтöг овны сьöкыд;[ɕɘm-tɘg ov-nɨ ɕɘkɨd];money-ABE live-INF difficult;It is difficult to live without money;

Name: Is there a separate case to mark the motion along or by the referent of the noun (prolative)?
Example: Öшиньöдыс пет!;[ɘʃiɲ-ɘd-ɨs pet];window-PROL-POSS.3SG exit.IMP.2SG;Go out through the window!;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks goal?
Example: Пыра керкаö;[pɨr-ɑ kerkɑ-ɘ];enter-PRS.1SG house-ILL;I am going into the house;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks location?
Example: Ме керкаын;[me kerkɑ-ɨn];1SG house-INE;I am in the house;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks source?
Example: Пета керкаысь;[pet-ɑ kerkɑ-ɨɕ];exit-PRS.1SG house-ELA;I am going from the house;

Name: Is there case syncretism of goal and location marking?
Example: керкаад;[kerkɑ-ɑd];house-ILL/INE.POSS.2SG;into your house / in your house;
Comment: There is syncretism in the possessive declention.

Name: Is there case syncretism of location and source marking?
Are there two sets of local cases?
Example: керкаö;[kerkɑ-ɘ];house-ILL;into a house;|керкаын;[kerkɑ-ɨn];house-INE;in a house;|керкаысь;[kerkɑ-ɨɕ];house-ELA;from a house;|керкаланьö;[kerkɑ-lɑɲɘ];house-APPR.ILL;to the direction of house;|керкаланьын;[kerkɑ-lɑɲɨn];house-APPR.INE;in the area of the house;|керкаланьысь;[kerkɑ-lɑɲɨɕ];house-APPR.ELA;from the direction of the house;

Name: Is there a third set of local cases?
Comment: There are only cases, which do not form a set.

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the means by which something is carried out (instrumental) and/or accompaniement (comitative)?
Example: паньöн [pɑɲ-ɘn];spoon-INS;with a spoon;|кагакöд [kɑgɑ-kɘd];child-COM;with a child;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking accompaniment, which is different from the instrumental?
Example: мамыдкöд;[mɑm-ɨd-kɘd];mother-POSS.2SG-COM;with your mother;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the result of change (translative) and/or a state of being (essive)?
Comment: Either the instrumental or nominative case is used.

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the state of being (essive), which is different from the translative?
Is there a separate morphological marker for expressing equative meaning?
Is there an inflectional nominal marker for expressing benefactive or destinative semantics independent from the dative?
Is there in addition to the basic declension a declension different from a possessive declension?
Is it possible to use singular with paired body parts/clothing/accessories that accompany them?
Example: Кöмыд няйт;[kɘm-ɨd ɲɑjt];shoe-POSS.2SG dirty;Your shoes are dirty;|гач [gɑt͡ɕ];trousers[NOM.SG];trousers;

Name: Can the marking of the possessor in the attributive construction vary?
Example: Вокыдлöн ёртыс бур;[vok-ɨd-lɘn jort-ɨs bur];brother-POSS.2SG-GEN friend-POSS.3SG good;Your brother's friend is good;|Ме тöда вокыдлысь ёртсö;[me tɘd-ɑ vok-ɨd-lɨɕ jort-sɘ];1SG know-PRS.1SG brother-POSS.2SG-ABL friend-ACC.POSS.3SG;I know your brother's friend;

Name: Can the possessor in the attributive construction be marked with the nominative?
Example: дöрöм сос;[dɘrɘm sos];;shirt sleeve;

Name: Is non-singular possession marked in the possessive declension?
Can 2Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Example: Олöмыд быдöнлы дона;[olɘm-ɨd bɨdɘn-lɨ donɑ];life-POSS.2SG everyone-DAT expensive;The life is valuable to everyone;

Name: Can 3Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Example: Енэжыс пемдiс;[jeneʒ-ɨs pemd-is];sky-POSS.3SG darken-PST.3SG;The sky darkened;

Name: Is there animacy distinction in independent interrogative pronouns?
Example: Кодi тайö?;[kodi tɑjɘ];who this;Who is it?;|Мый тайö?;[mɨj tɑjɘ];what this;What is it?;

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for animates other than humans?
Example: сiйö каньыс, кодi...;[sijɘ kɑɲ-ɨs, kodi];that cat-POSS.3SG who;that cat who…;

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for inanimates?
Example: Тэнад эм небöг, кодi меным колö;[tenɑd em ɲebɘg, kodi menɨm kol-ɘ];you.GEN EX book who 1SG.DAT to.be.need-PRS.3SG;You have a book, what I need;

Name: Can a demonstrative stem be used in the function of a pronoun with 3rd person singular human referent?
Example: сiйö;[sijɘ];;s/he;|сiйö пуыс;[sijɘ pu-ɨs];that tree-POSS.3SG;that tree;|тайö пуыс;[tɑjɘ pu-ɨs];this tree-POSS.3SG;this tree;|Тайö нинöм оз тöд;[tɑjɘ ɲinɘm o-z tɘd];this nothing NEG.PRS-3SG know.CNG.SG;This knows nothing;

Name: Is the order of possessive suffix and case suffix across the paradigm the same?
Comment: The order is not fixed (it depends on a case).

Name: Is the order of number and case suffixes fixed across the paradigm the same?
Example: зонъяслы;[zon-jɑs-lɨ];boy-PL-DAT;to the boys;

Name: Are there different words for mother’s brother and father’s brother?
Example: чож;[t͡ɕoʒ];;mother’s brother;|унай;[unɑj];;father’s brother;

Name: Are there different words for younger and older relative for other relations than siblings?
Example: унiнь;[uniɲ];;mother’s older sister;|об;[ob];;father’s older sister;|унай;[unɑj];;father’s older brother;

Name: Is there animacy distinction for both concepts 'new/young' and 'old'?
Example: том : пöрысь;[tom] : [pɘrɨɕ];young : old (animate);|выль : важ [vɨʎ] : [vɑʒ];new : old (inanimate);

Name: Is there distinction for both 'warm' and 'cold' based on whether referring to weather or to temperature of objects?
Example: пöсь : кöдзыд;;hot (object) : cold (object, can also be used about weather);|жар : ыркыд;;warm (weather) : cool (weather, cannot be used to describe an object);

Name: Is there contrastive length of consonants?
Is there contrastive length of vowels?
Is there contrast between short and long unstressed vowels?
Is there contrast in duration of geminate consonants?
Are there more than two phonological quantities?
Are there extralong syllables?
Is the main foot structure trochaic?
Example: керка [kerkɑ] 'house'

Name: Is there lexically distinctive word stress?
Is there morphologically conditioned stress?
Is there fixed primary stress?
Is there stress in heavy syllables?
Is there non-initial primary stress?
Is there palatal vowel harmony?
Is there velar vowel harmony?
Is there labial vowel harmony?
Are there rising diphthongs?
Are there lowering diphthongs?
Is there qualitative contrast between subsets of short and long vowels?
Are there full vs. reduced vowels as contrastive subsets?
Is there front high rounded vowel ü [y]?
Is there front midhigh rounded vowel ö [ø]?
Is there back high unrounded vowel ï [ɯ]?
Example: шыр [ʃɨr] 'mouse'

Name: Is there back midhigh unrounded vowel ë [ɤ]?
Example: шöр [ʃɘr] 'centre'

Name: Is there back low round vowel [ɒ]?
Is there contrast between low and mid front vowels (ä [æ] vs. e [e])?
Are there word-initial consonant clusters?
Example: врач [vrɑt͡ʃ ] 'doctor', трин-трон [trin-tron] 'ding-dong'
Comment: Only in loan words and descriptive words.

Name: Are there word-internal consonant clusters in syllable onset?
Are there consonant clusters in syllable coda?
Example: пурт [purt] 'knife', муртса [murtsɑ] 'bit, not much'

Name: Are there clusters of three or more consonants in a word between vowels?
Example: муртса [murtsɑ] 'bit, not much'

Name: Are there word-final clusters of three or more consonants?
Are there palatalized dentals?
Are there palatalized labials and velars?
Is there palatal stop [c]?
Example: бать [bɑc] 'father'

Name: Is there palatal nasal [ɲ]?
Example: нянь [ɲɑɲ] 'bread'

Name: Is there palatal lateral [ʎ]?
Example: нёль [ɲoʎ] 'four'

Name: Is there phonemic velar nasal [ŋ]?
Is there dental affricate [t͡s]?
Comment: Only in new loanwords, e.g. цемент [t͡sement] 'cement'.

Name: Is there non-alveolar affricate (e.g. [t͡ʃ], [͡cɕ])?
Example: чача [t͡ʃɑt͡ʃɑ] 'toy'

Name: Is there a phonological contrast between [s] and postalveolar sibilant [ʃ]?
Example: шыр [ʃɨr] 'mouse'

Name: Are there voiced plosives [b, g, d]?
Example: дуб [dub] 'unsalted'

Name: Is there glottal stop [ˀ]?
Is there phonological contrast between plain and labial velar consonants (e.g. [k] vs. [kʷ])?
Is there a constraint on word-initial r?
Is there laryngeal fricative [h]?
Is there voiced velar fricative [ɣ]?
Is there voiceless velar fricative [x]?
Comment: Only in new loanwords, e.g. вахта [vɑхtɑ] 'watch'.

Name: Is there voiced dental fricative [ð]?
Is there phonemic labio-velar approximant [w]?
Is there voiceless labiodental fricative [f]?
Comment: Only in new loanwords, e.g. фен [fen] 'blow dryer'.

Name: Is there radical qualitative consonant gradation?
Is there quantitative consonant gradation?
